Line 46: Line 46:  
Some religions have specific teachings relating to wisdom.
 
Some religions have specific teachings relating to wisdom.
    −
===Abrahamic religions (Old Testament)===
+
===Old Testament===
     
In the [[Christianity|Christian]] [[Bible]] and [[Judaism|Jewish]] scripture, wisdom is represented by the sense of justice of the lawful and wise king [[Solomon]], who asks God for wisdom in [[1 Kings]] 3. Much of the [[Book of Proverbs]], a book of wise sayings, is attributed to Solomon. In Proverbs 1:7 and 9:10, the [[Fear of the lord|fear of the Lord]] is called the beginning or foundation of wisdom while Proverbs 8:13 declares "To fear the Lord is to hate evil". In Proverbs 1:20, there is also reference to wisdom personified in female form, "Wisdom calls aloud in the street, she raises her voice in the public squares."
 
In the [[Christianity|Christian]] [[Bible]] and [[Judaism|Jewish]] scripture, wisdom is represented by the sense of justice of the lawful and wise king [[Solomon]], who asks God for wisdom in [[1 Kings]] 3. Much of the [[Book of Proverbs]], a book of wise sayings, is attributed to Solomon. In Proverbs 1:7 and 9:10, the [[Fear of the lord|fear of the Lord]] is called the beginning or foundation of wisdom while Proverbs 8:13 declares "To fear the Lord is to hate evil". In Proverbs 1:20, there is also reference to wisdom personified in female form, "Wisdom calls aloud in the street, she raises her voice in the public squares."
